meanings.definition: gnarrs (verb): to make a harsh, grating sound
meanings.sent1: The old door gnarrs loudly when it is opened.
meanings.sent2: The rusty gate gnarrs as it swings back and forth.
meanings.sent3: The gnarrs of the broken chair made everyone in the room chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The wind gnarrs through the trees like a ghostly whisper.
meanings.sent5: The car brakes gnarrs as it comes to a sudden stop.

meanings.sent1: The gnarrs of the machinery echoed through the factory.
meanings.sent2: The chalkboard made a loud gnarrs when the teacher wrote on it.
meanings.sent3: The gnarrs of the cat's meow sounded strangely musical.
meanings.sent4: The gnarrs of the thunderstorm kept everyone awake at night.
meanings.sent5: The gnarrs of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.

meanings.definition: gnarrs (adjective): harsh and grating in sound or appearance
meanings.sent1: The gnarrs voice of the witch sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent2: The gnarrs texture of the sandpaper made it perfect for smoothing wood.
meanings.sent3: The gnarrs design of the building stood out among the modern structures.
meanings.sent4: The gnarrs color of the graffiti clashed with the surrounding artwork.
meanings.sent5: The gnarrs sound of the alarm clock startled me awake.
